choices.text:
in python calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
Sure, here is an example in Python to do this.  First we create some random integers between 1-10 that will be used for our sample data set (list). We then use two functions called "mean" which calculates mean value or arithmetic average over the given sequence and returns it as a float number; while standard deviation function takes list of numbers, computes their values' deviations from its own calculated means.
def random_integers(): 
    return [random.randint(1, 10) for _ in range (10)] 
print("The mean value is: ",mean([float(x)/100  for x in   random_integers()]))
